A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
What in God's name did I just watch?

To be clear\, I'm not one of those insufferable Star Wars fans that is impossible to please. The Force Awakens was among my favorite of the saga\, but the direction Rian Johnson took the story and its characters was neither "bold" nor "brave." It was just nonsensical. Ridiculous. Subverting the audience's expectations for the sake of shock value isn't good storytelling. It's hackery. Everything I loved about Star Wars has been destroyed. A terrific cast and an abundance of talent behind the camera have been squandered. 

The film was an absolute mess: gaping plot holes\, entire sequences that could have been omitted entirely\, new characters that served literally no purpose\, a lack of practical effects in favor of a gratuitous CGI\, and alas\, a gross perversion of the Star Wars mythology. How did Kathleen Kennedy approve this script? Rian was supposed to be LucasFilm's golden boy? What happened? It's been said by many\, but I'll say it again; to say I am disappointed by this move would be an understatement.
